TopicTitle: you can rename vessels from the tracking center!

Articles.Content:
Where has this been all my life!

in the tracking center, select a vessel, then click the orange bar on the top of the window and voila a renamer for any ship, controllable or not!

Edited September 23, 2015 by peachoftree
Mind = blown
Nice find! Thanks!
Whaaaaaaaaaaat? D:
So...I loaded up my .23.5 game...apparently it was a thing back then...time to see how far this goes...
the lower bound is v0.18: http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Version_history#v0.18.0

Yeah, it's a well hidden feature. It works from Map View as well (although there's some restrictions).

However.. this sort of thread pops up from time to time.. We talked about it in the BTSM thread, and there's been some talk in General as well.

So basically .. this gets 'discovered' from time to time, due to it's hidden nature and KSP's kinda poor documentation. Hooray for poor documentation!

Yeah, it's a well hidden feature. It works from Map View as well (although there's some restrictions).

However.. this sort of thread pops up from time to time.. We talked about it in the BTSM thread, and there's been some talk in General as well.

So basically .. this gets 'discovered' from time to time, due to it's hidden nature and KSP's kinda poor documentation. Hooray for poor documentation!

hopefully KSPedia will fix that.

the lower bound is v0.18: http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Version_history#v0.18.0

Yes, at first it was just in the flight scene when right clicking a command pod/probe. But I loaded up .22 just now, and I can't change the name of a vessel in the tracking station, but I can in .23.5 (I can't find my .23 install atm).
Great, I just deployed my fairing to change name, and you now tell me I could do this through tracking center? Ugh.
THIS is such an important feature. Does Squad know this exists? How comes nobody knew about this?! This is great, thanks!

THIS is such an important feature. Does Squad know this exists? How comes nobody knew about this?! This is great, thanks!

A lot of people probably thought this is common knowledge.

People like me who try clicking on everything to figure out how stuff works tend to find stuff like this (I noticed this in map mode first tho). Still... I wonder how many other features are still to be found.

A lot of people probably thought this is common knowledge....

Well, uh, yeah, maybe. It's not mentioned in the Infotextbox you get for visiting the trackingstation the first time or is it?
Good find. Always wanted to rename stuff in tracking station. Yet one of these totally unintuitive features hidden in the game since SQUAD is simply too lazy to add buttons for them in the UI.

Well, uh, yeah, maybe. It's not mentioned in the Infotextbox you get for visiting the trackingstation the first time or is it?

To be fair, if every single feature got told in those boxes we'd have quite a bit of stuff to read there. I'm really hoping the KSPedia will have good pages for each view with all the features explained. That should be a lot better than forcing the info on first load of a game.

However, while we do have good documentations on what keys are mapped by default (and we can change those too), a lot of people still won't know half of the keys they could use to make life easier.
Oh man... memories of spending more than an hour loading up and renaming 50+ ships... and all this time...

Yes. Dead useful, stupidly obscure, doesn't work in map view despite the widgets looking the same.

Fortunately that bit of the UI is something that's getting a redesign for 1.1.

I have known about renaming things from the tracking station since I read this post from Apollo13 back in August '14: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/91094-0-25-Tracking-Station-Utils-v0-2-Display-some-vessel-s-info-in-TS?p=1361167&viewfull=1#post1361167
I've known about this, but there are other stuff I don't know about. Part of the fun of this game is finding new stuff.

Found this about a month ago... quite useful, and i hope this survives the UI redisign

Honestly, i hope they document things like this better now that 1.0 is released...
Looked for that yesterday with no luck. Thanks for the info. *thumbsup*
wow... I had no clue.... awesome! thanks!!!

I thought this was common knowledge lol.

It's the best way to re-categorize uncontrollable debris.
I thought everyone knew this...
Rumor has it you can also fly rockets in this game!
